title.narrative: GUY 1.1 CP AND JUSTICE SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Increased country capacity to promote and ensure justice and systems that enable the prevention and treatment of violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect, which contributes to Birth Registration, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Justice For Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national legislation is implemented to prevent, mitigate and address violence and other childhood abuses and the justice, education, public health, security and other sectors observe children's rights to this protection.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased country capacity to promote and ensure justice and systems that enable the prevention and treatment of violence, abuse,exploitation and neglect

description.narrative: UNICEFGuyana focused on strengthening access to; justice; in 9 courts services for reporting and treatment of domestic violence; supporting a stronger enabling environment through policy, legal and plans of action on domestic violence (DV Bill 2021 and draft NPAs),; generating evidence to drive change; (1 research)and advocating for new laws on prevention of harassment (including sexual harassment) with CP partners. Political leadership, intersectoral coordination and adequate budgets (at all levels) for child protection are; key tools for strengthening both the system and the protective environment.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/01/2022
